title: Neglected!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: economical,central and clean
review: Only good thing is the location for this hotel! If you are going to the city for holiday, NOT RECOMMENDED! It's neglected!   If you are going for businnes of your own! It might be a good choice because of its location.  Helpful staff! Good location! but neglected!

title: *Wanna few days more;:)))*
review: The location is central.the team is very helpful and friendly.the breakfast is delicious.the rooms are good but the street was a bit noisy at night.the place is clean and rooms are cleaned every day.i would always come back to this place if i am tight on budget or want to save some money.

title: good and economical
review: Hotel mono suites is a good place to spend few days in relaxioned atnosphera. It is well located. it is very  Close and easy to get from here to haghia Sophia and blue mosque. What is more tram Is distanced maybe only  1 minute from here!!!big advantage is the staff.  Guys at reception are very kind and helpful for any case  Always smiling and do their best. Rooms are cosy, bright and clean. Breakfasts  tasty including traditional Turkish food like cheese, olives, bread or fruits and vegetables. My Idea to change  something is to make lobby up.it seems to be dark  and grim. It could be a good idea to place big picture of istanbul panorama and place flowers  for example orchidea. One more time thanks mono suits your  for such good days!!!!

title: very central
review: I have visited this hotel frequently during my business trips to Istanbul....I should say the staff is good....rooms are small but clean....location is in the heart of city so going around the bazar areas is very convenient.....easy transport facilities available from the hotel....overall if you don't want to spent much and want to have easy access to the main areas of the city I would recommend this hotel......

title: Great location,, good services,,
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very well located hotel
review: I spent three days in the hotels ,,good located to visit museums and tourism places,,the staff was very helpful and ready to give you all the information you need it,,  rooms are clean,restaurant are good,, the wifi is excellent ,,close to all the places you want to go,, easy access to transpositions ,,and also with a good value of money,I recommend this hotel for sure

title: Noisy, expnsive, no view! I recommand not to go there.
review: I spent five days in this hotel, very well located to visit Sultanahmet, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazar and Topkapi that are a few minutes walk. There is also a tram station very close which can bring easily to Taksim.The staff is very helpful and ready to give you information.The rooms are clean and spacious enough.The wifi in the hotel is of excellent quality.  I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are looking for a hotel having everything close, and with a good value for money.

title: Noor Azman Sandiman visitor from Malaysia
review: The main issue is the noise in the room. From one side there is the street from.the other the AC is making the same noise than a water toilet tank that is being filled by water. But it never stop ...I asked to change room, it was exactly the same except that bathroom did not work.  Moreover I was expecting a view from the rooftop. We have a view on the roof top which HAVE a view...  Last I was asked to pay something like 50usd for that, I stayed long time ago in and youth hostel in this area which was quarter of that price and much better.  Only positive point is the fact that the people are nice and trying to help.

title: Great location ! Helpful staff!
review: Mono Suites staff pick us up (at no cost !) in-bound from YeniKeppi Jetty and arranged for a luxurious Mercedes Vito to Ataturk Airport (out-bound) - hassle free   A real value for money - especially during peak season.  Great location: a few minutes walk to Blue Mosque and very close to Grand Bazaar. 2 blocks from Sultan Ahmet tram station, very close to McDonald, Starbuck, Sultan Ahmet Lokumcusu (Turkish Delight & Baklava) and situated 3 tram stations towards the infamous south-bound Spice Market  Their well trained and friendly staff are always available to assist our need - specifically for our special needs with big family & travelling with children  Very personalized cleaning crew and Farouk the friendly front desk personnel  For our next trip to Istanbul, we will book…

title: excellent hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Its just bed and breakfast
review: We had a great time in Mono suites hotel. Staff were very friendly, nice and helpful. The place is clean and breakfast is very good. Excellent location, it's situated on a walking distance from the major attractions of the old city.

title: v.good
review: Good thing first, delicious breakfast and coaprative staff clean bed. But, the bathroom dose not work in the 2 rooms we switched in during our stay , the light was like candle , the currtens was old , and when you swim the water will fload from below the bath , and itwas 90 $  anight ,not like whatthey wrot, with this money there are many hotels in that area with better services

title: Good
review: One of the best hotels in Turkey, a team collaborator, if i come to Turkey again I will go for this hotel I wish success to all the staff, and I hope to be one of the best hotels in the world I heard he will get change for a hotel for the best I wish you success  Lena

title: Good, but the driver failed to come back
review: Nice hotel, with friendly staff at walking distance from the principal monuments. The breakfast is a little strange as the it is on a cellar without Windows or natural light but is very good. At very good price for the place at center Istambul, if what you need is a good place to sleep only near the places to visit at a good price this is good. The room are a little small but good.

title: Less was not more
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: فندق في غاية الروعة قمة في النضافة
review: Friends booked this well-located hotel through a travel agent. We three arrived and Mono had no record of our confirmed reservation. They were not interested in seeing/ knowing our confirmation# or our reservation ID# or even looking up our name. They said they only booked through Orbitz. However as we were "not checking in," another party were in the lobby at the same time who HAD BOOKED through Orbitz and they were "not checking in" either. Mono found other accommodations for us and walked us and our baggage there for one night. Our other 3 nights were here at Mono. Besides the desk phone noise jangling through our adjacent walls and the damp, musky smell, the beds were reasonable comfortable and breakfast in the basement dungeon was tasty. Also, don't  bring your counted…

title: a wonderful hotel
review: غرف ضيقة نسبيا بس صالحة لشخصين نظيفة افطار نسبيا ضعيف مقارنة مع فنادق اخرى قريب من المواقع التاريخية قريب من محطة السلطان احمد beautiful hotel clean and sympatiqhe persones i like it and i advice other people to go to it because its near all historique places and near station of sultan ahmet and very easy to find it ..the breakfast not like other hotels and need to be better ..the place of breakfast soo small just 3 tables ..i dont like the room in the first flore because its soo nosy every time some on open the door of the hotel make u wake up

title: Good!!^^
review: a wonderful hotel The crew of the reception and staff were all kind and polite Ten days spent with two of my friends so wonderful Hotel is very nearby to the Sultan Ahmed Mosque and Hagia Sophia, just a few meters to the Sultanahmet tram station and a suitable place to move to the outskirts of Istanbul Located in a relatively quiet area, and breakfast was in the basement, but it was a clean place and the meals were delicious and also the employee was always smiling, cleanliness excellent hotel, the Internet reach all places, it is true the hotel is small but wonderful I will return again for hotel housing and I would recommend everyone  فندق رائع كان طاقم الاستقبال والموظفون جميعاً طيبون ومؤدبون  عشرة ايام قضيتها مع 2 من اصدقائي رائعة جداً الفندق قريب جدا من جامع السلطان احمد…

title: great location, good service
review: All the staff was friendly. Especially! Manager oppa ~~! ^^ Thank you!! Great location for sightseeing was too good .. Next time will come again in Istanbul ..  I study English hard. Next, we would like to talk more. Then I'll see you again ~ ~  Kahye(≥∀≤)/
